verbose_text: The first step starts at about 94-95 degreesC for a few minutes to separate DNA double strands; the second at around 50-60 degreesC to allow hybridization between specific primers and their targeted DNA sequences; and the third step at around 68-72 degreesC to allow DNA polymerase to elongate the primers alongside their targeted template.
evidence: step at around 68-72 degreesC to allow DNA polymerase
